title: Brit dies in horror fall from Hawaii balcony saving suicidal teen pal as both plummet to floor

A British man died in a horror fall from the 14th floor of a Hawaii building after he clambered out to save a suicidal pal. 
Tommy Bennett crept out on to the ledge of a dormitory building in Honolulu to try and help a distraught friend who was claiming he wanted to kill himself. 
Brave Tommy, 24, of Plymouth, spoke with his tearful friend and managed to convince him to come back inside, but as the pair began to move towards the safety of the building, the window gave way. Tommy Bennett's mum Lesley Heard (centre) receives a Pride of Plymouth award on behalf of her son (Photo: SWNS) Read More Transgender woman accused of trying to murder man in knife attack is found hanged in men's prison 
Both young men plummet to the floor where Tommy died but his friend, who has not been named, survived in August 2015. 
Tommy's mother Lesley Heard, 51, from Plymouth, Devon, now says she has forgiven the man he was trying to save, 
She told the BBC: "I felt it was important for my recovery and his that we spoke. 
"We have messaged each other several times but I felt it was really important to tell him that I knew it was an accident, that he was under great pressure at the time and I didn't blame him. " 
The senior Plymouth and south Devon coroner Ian Arrow recorded an accidental death conclusion. Thomas Bennett who has died trying to stop a 19 year old committing suicide (Photo: SWNS) 
In doing so he described Mr Bennett - whose mother lives in Plymouth - as a 'brave and noble man'. 
At the time of the incident landscaper Mr Bennett, who was living in Hawaii, was hailed a hero for his brave actions. 
Police say the 19-year-old was badly hurt in the incident and was taken to hospital in a critical condition. 
The two men were visiting a student at the dormitory at the time of the incident. It is reported there was a party ahead of the start of the new university semester.
